alert.note: Alert for McCreary; Pulaski; Wayne (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 22 at 11:43AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Wayne, Pulaski and central McCreary Counties through 1215 PM EST... At 1143 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Cains Store to Faubush to Zula to 7 miles east of Celina. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Nancy, Naomi, Susie, Hidalgo, Pointer, Stab, Faubush, Powersburg, Hogue and Mill Springs around 1150 AM EST. Pulaski County Park, Cooper, Frazer, Slickford and Betsey around 1155 AM EST. Burnside, Burfield, Bronston, Somerset Pulaski Airport, Quinton, Oil Valley, Barrier, Kidder and Mount Pisgah around 1200 PM EST. Other locations in the path of these storms include Somerset, Tateville, Elihu, General Burnside S.P., Griffin, Rockeybranch, Parmleysville, Coopersville, Sloans Valley, Alpine, Ruth, Kidds Crossing, Slavens, Great Meadows Campsites, Ritner, Co- Operative, Greenwood, Grade, Dykes, Mount Victory, Blue Heron, Parkers Lake and Bent. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
